subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Islam in Southeast Asia: Traders, Not Armies
description: A quick win: understand Islam in Southeast Asia: Traders, Not Armies.

hook.text: Indonesia is the world's largest Muslim country. Islam arrived there not by sword but by merchant ship and marriage.

buildup.text: From the 13th century, Muslim traders from India and Arabia settled in Southeast Asian ports and married locally.

discovery.text: Sufi mystics blended Islam with local Hindu-Buddhist traditions. The result was a uniquely gentle, syncretic Islam.

twist.text: Today, 230 million Indonesian Muslims practice a form of Islam quite different from Arab or Iranian traditions.

climax.text: Southeast Asia proves Islam spreads through culture and commerce, not just conquest. Trade was its greatest missionary.

punchline.text: Islam reached Indonesia by trade, not conquest. Commerce spread the faith.

quiz.question: How did Islam spread to Southeast Asia?
options: Through trade, intermarriage, and Sufi missionaries
